questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Concurrency Control in a DBMS?
options: To manage concurrent execution of operations to maintain consistency
To delete old data from the database
To increase the storage capacity of the hard drive
questions.answer: To manage concurrent execution of operations to maintain consistency

questions.question: What does 'concurrent execution' mean in a multi-user system?
options: Multiple users accessing the same database at different times
Multiple users accessing the same database at one time
A single user performing multiple tasks sequentially
Shutting down the database for maintenance
questions.answer: Multiple users accessing the same database at one time

questions.question: According to the text, how should simultaneous execution be performed to maintain consistency?
options: By blocking all users except one
By duplicating the database for every user

questions.question: When does a Dirty Read Problem occur?
options: When a transaction reads data that has been committed
When a transaction reads an updated item that is later rolled back
When two transactions read the same data simultaneously
When a transaction fails to read any data
questions.answer: When a transaction reads an updated item that is later rolled back
